info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 25 at 3:10AM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. * WHERE...Canyon Ferry Area, Helena Valley, Meagher County Valleys, Missouri Headwaters, and Northwest Beaverhead County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM MDT this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes, mainly today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A break in the snow is expected starting this afternoon, but another wave of snow overspreads the area tonight and into the day on Thursday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
